strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_def>*: Maella Abbey is a sacred place, under the divine protection of the Goddess.
<se_def>*: Leave your secular life at the door and pray for Her mercy.
<se_def>*: If the weight of sin bears down upon you, may I suggest a contribution of gold to the abbey?
<se_def>*: This will please the Goddess, and She will grant you an indulgence.
<se_def>*: Here at Maella Abbey we offer repose for the spirit.
<se_def>*: If it is repose for the body you seek, may I suggest that you go across the river and take lodgings in Simpleton.
<se_def>*: Oh, Goddess! Have I not paid enough!? Please, let me be rid of the debt collector once and for all!
<se_high>*: Oh, you came over here on the ferry, did you? I do love boats!
<se_low>*: Maella Abbey is the most important place of worship on this continent. Like you, I have travelled far to pray here.
<se_low>*: Almighty Goddess! Now may I be welcomed at the gates of heaven when I pass from this world!? I have paid 5000 gold coins!
<se_def>*: Unwashed vagrants are not permitted to approach the Holy Altar!
<se_def>*: May the Goddess strike you down! This is exactly why the Templars need to guard it!
<se_def>*: Ah, it is the anniversary of your grandmother's passing. Let us hold a special mass. Naturally, there will be the small matter of a fee...
<se_low>*: The abbey's demanding ‘donations’ from me now, you know!
<se_low>*: It never used to be the case. Not when the old Templar Captain was in charge.

<se_high>*: Oh, where is Angelo!?
I only come here to see him!<page>*: And I never miss a day, because each new day is a new chance to catch a glimpse of my scrumptious hero!
<se_high>*: All the other boys are such bumpkins. They're all so boring. (Yawn)
<se_def>*: Maella Abbey belongs to the trinity of sacred sites, along with the Holy Isle of Neos and Savella Cathedral.
<se_def>*: In his younger days, our Holy Premier, the Lord High Priest, graced us with his presence here.
<se_def>*: Whenever we pray, we turn to face Savella Cathedral where His Holiness resides.
<se_def>*: Captain Marcello is the presiding head of the Templars.
<se_def>*: As the most able man among us, he was appointed by Abbot Francisco to act as his aide.<page>*: He is entrusted to carry out the majority of the Holy Father's business.
<se_def>*: Curse you! Now I'm in the Captain's bad books! Get out of here!
<se_def>*: Dear Goddess, I pray for your help. How long I have coveted a post among the Templars! Please, grant me my wish...

<se_def>*: How about we head over to The Cock and Bull in Simpleton tomorrow?<page>*: They've got some rather fine bunny girls in there, you know.
Not a bad pub, all things considered!
<se_def>*: Huh, Angelo's favourite pub? If he's there, all the girls will be drooling over him. They won't give us a second glance.
<se_def>*: Are you <IF_SOLO>a pilgrim<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>pilgrims<ENDIF_SOLO>? You must have travelled a great distance to be arriving at such a late hour. May the Goddess smile upon you always.
<se_def>*: This is the way to the Holy Father's private residence. <IF_SOLO>A wanderer like you has<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>Wanderers like you have<ENDIF_SOLO> no business there.
<se_def>*: You will leave. Now.
<se_high>*: Angelo just got back and he brushed my hand as he passed by! Oooh, he's so dreamy!
<voice_0x01000B6A><se_def>*: What do you want?
<voice_0x01000B6B><se_def>*: What? You've come to return Angelo's ring?
<voice_0x01000B4C><se_def>*: Hmph! Put it up as credit at the pub again, did he? That boy's a disgrace!

<voice_0x01000B4E><se_def>*: Very well, then!
Angelo's inside.
Now hurry up!
<se_def>*: Our Templar's rings are engraved with the emblem of the abbey.
<se_def>*: What is it!?
<se_def>*: Hm? You're here to give Angelo his ring back?
<voice_0x01000B4C><se_def>*: I suppose the little scallywag used it to fund a bet at the pub again, did he? Hmph!
<voice_0x01000B4E><se_def>*: Fine! He's inside. Make it quick!
<se_def>*: Only Abbot Francisco and we Templars are permitted to wear these rings. They're engraved with the emblem of the abbey.<page>*: Normal monks are not worthy of such a privilege.
<se_def>*: Next to his faith and his life, the ring is a Templar's most treasured possession. But Angelo...! Hmph!
<se_def>*: That miserable excuse for a Templar, Angelo, has been at the pub again. His grog-soaked breath heaps shame on our abbey!
<se_def>*: I suppose you've come to collect on the debts he owes?
<se_def>*: He's in his room. Just at the top of the stairs.
<se_high>*: Our duty as monks is to serve the Abbot and the Templars.
<se_high>*: We're here to take care of their meals and clean the abbey and whatnot. To give them anything they require, really.
<se_def>*: Abbot Francisco is a man of the utmost virtue.
<se_def>*: He embraces all those who have lost their family or are in need of shelter, and gives them the chance to live here as members of the abbey.
<se_high>*: The Templars are an elite class, with unparalleled knowledge of both the sword and the scriptures.
<se_high>*: They are known as ‘The Goddess's Steel’, here to protect the Abbot and preserve peace and order in Maella's dominion.
<se_def>*: Prayer and hard work. Such is the life of a monk.
<se_def>*: Although there are those in the order who sneak off to the pub from time to time!
<se_def>*: Can't you see I'm trying to get some sleep!? I'm off duty now. ...Hm? You're looking for Angelo? Well, I haven't seen him.
<se_def>*: The Templars are said to have begun as a collection of mounted guardsmen.<page>*: They were employed to protect large churches and keep the peace at important religious services.
<se_def>*: Our predecessors were spectacular to behold, flaunting the majesty of the church and the glory of the Goddess.<page>*: But they were nothing more than puppets, of course.
<se_def>*: The Templars of today are very different. We are the knights of the Goddess! An elite order of warriors admired by all!
<se_def>*: This is Captain Marcello's chamber!
<se_def>*: The Captain manages all of the Holy Father's affairs now that he is too frail to take care of matters himself.
<se_def>*: But he's not here. Just a short while ago he went downstairs. Looking very displeased, I might warn you.
<se_def>*: He should be in the torture chamber now, giving Angelo the dressing down he deserves. Huh huh! I wish I could see it for myself!

<se_def>*: I'll let you in on a little secret.<page>*: Though Captain Marcello is not the kind of man to take any nonsense from anyone, he'll never challenge the word of Abbot Francisco.<page>*: He's been like a father to Marcello, you see.
<se_def>*: I don't know the full story, but apparently the wealthy family into which Marcello was born gave him up to the abbey for some reason.
<se_def>*: This is the interrogation room. Beyond it is the torture chamber, used in days of old to convert heretics to the faith.
<se_def>*: You're free to enter the interrogation room, but Captain Marcello is using the back room at the moment, so it's off limits.
<se_def>*: Abbot Francisco is a very kind and gentle soul. He would agree to see anyone who requested an audience with him.
<se_def>*: That's why we're here. To protect him from the riff-raff he's too polite to turn away! Now clear off!
<se_def>*: Urgh... Who is he...? That...jester...
<se_def>*: The...Abbot... Some...one, please...save...
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: They say that the Holy Father, Abbot Francisco, is descended from a very great prophet.
<se_def>*: According to the abbey records, the prophet was one of a group of heroes who battled to save the world from a terrible fate.<page>*: Of course, that would all be a long time ago now.
<se_def>*: But it goes to show how greatness does pass down through the generations.
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: Templar Angelo was never particularly dedicated to the cause, but his shameful behaviour of late simply cannot be ignored!
<se_def>*: I doubt even Captain Marcello's patience can be stretched much further.
<se_def>*: Aaaah! I'm exhausted.
<se_def>*: It's taken me this long to finish washing all the dishes from dinner.
<se_high>*: Zzzz... Ah... Let me be <endash> Ah-phew... <endash> one of...the Templars...
<se_high>*: I've a terrible presentiment. As if something awful is about to befall us.
<se_def>*: Zzzzz...zzzzz...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew-phew-phew...
<se_def>*: Angelo's getting a tongue-lashing downstairs at the moment! Huh huh huh!
<se_def>*: I'll let you in on a little secret. There are whisperings in the order that Marcello has his eye on the abbacy!
<se_def>*: Apparently, Captain Marcello is hoping to be the next abbot.
<se_def>*: But the Holy Father still has plenty of life left in him, despite his age. The Captain's dream is a long way off.
No answer...
Looks like he's passed out.
<se_def>*: Somebody! Save the Abbot!
<se_def>*: Urgh! I'm not...going to make it... That jester...
<se_low>Yangus: Wot a bleedin' nerve! We ain't done nuffin'! LET US OUT OF 'ERE!
<se_low>King Trode: I'm no monster! I am a king! Blast every one of those Templar twerps!
<se_high>Jessica: There's no point screaming. We've got to use our heads and get out of this cell!
<se_high>Jessica: Can't you think of anything, <hero>?
<se_low>King Trode: I'm not sure I like that young man's attitude! Thinks he can order me around because I'm shorter than him, does he!?
<se_low>King Trode: But this could be our chance! We should cooperate with him until we escape this place, <hero>!
<se_high>Jessica: If we stay here, we'll be tortured. What else can we do? We've got to go.
<se_low>Yangus: I'll go along wiv wotever you decide, guv! So, wot's it to be then, eh?
<se_def>Angelo: If we hang around for too long, they'll catch me helping you to escape. Let's move!
<se_def>*: Aaaah...no one...will get past...zzzz...me...
<se_def>*: DO NOT PANIC! It's just a small fire in the kitchen. We'll soon have it out.
<se_high>*: We could see the flames from Simpleton!
<se_high>*: I hope Angelo's all right.
<se_high>*: Have you heard!? Some traveller went and set fire to the abbey! He wasn't from around here, of course!
<se_def>*: I'm going on a trip to buy some stock, so I thought I'd come and pray for safe passage. This isn't exactly a good start, is it!?
<se_def>*: Now then, now then! Now then! Water! In buckets! ...Where are the buckets!?
<se_def>*: Argh! It's scorching! Blast! We can't get to the Abbot!
<se_def>*: The bridge! It's going to collapse!
<se_def>*: We've got to get across to the island before it goes down in flames! Stop wasting time, you cowards!
<se_def>*: A Templar's duty is to protect the Holy Father and preserve peace and order in Maella's dominion!
<se_def>*: ...But how can we protect him with these flames!? There's no way to get to him!
<se_def>*: Angelo just came running in here from outside.
<se_def>*: And I heard he was confined to the abbey doing penance! The wretched sinner's had the gall to flout his detention!
<se_low>*: Everyone just ran off inside a moment ago. Has something happened?
<se_low>*: Oh! I came to buy an indulgence, but it looks like they're all sold out, are they?
<se_def>*: It's no use! The end is nigh! Every one of us will be devoured in the flames of hell!
<se_def>*: This fountain isn't enough to put out the flames! What are we going to do!?
<se_def>*: It's too dangerous to stay here. Anyone who is not a resident of the abbey should leave before they're caught in the flames.
<se_def>*: There's no need to worry about the Abbot.<page>*: Captain Marcello and an elite detail of guards keep a night-long watch over the Holy Father's residence.
<se_def>*: Mind you, I can't imagine how this fire got started with them on guard.
<se_def>*: The Goddess must be angry! Or maybe this is the work of an evil demon! I just pray that the Abbot is safe.
<se_def>*: There seems to be quite a commotion outside. I wonder what's going on.
<se_high>*: I just saw Angelo scouring the Templars' quarters from end to end. It's most unlike him to be so earnest about anything.
<se_high>*: I suppose he was looking for Marcello. He probably wanted to report about the fire.
<se_def>*: What!? A fire!?
<se_def>*: I see. I'm on my way!
<se_def>*: I was right! Those travellers WERE in league with the monster we found! Oh, this is a sad day for the abbey!
<se_def>*: Urgh...my leg! That jester... He's...evil...
<se_def>*: Holy Father! Save yourse<endash>! Urgh...
<se_def>*: Urrrrgh!
<se_def>*: Curse him! He got me in the chest! I think he cracked a few of my ribs!
<se_high>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: We don't have enough medication to treat so many wounded!
<se_def>*: Gurrgh... He's strong... He can't...be huma<endash> Urgh...
<se_def>*: But what about the Templars!? What kind of man could have overpowered so many of them!?
The Templar is gravely wounded and has lost consciousness.
The Templar is slumped on the floor, covered in blood.
<se_low>Yangus: Mornin', guv. Looks like Dhoulmagus gave us the slip again, eh?
<se_low>Yangus: An' all them people dead... I can't believe it.
<se_low>Yangus: I dunno, I just don't feel like doin' nuffin' now. I can't be bothered.
<se_high>Jessica: I couldn't sleep at all last night.
<se_high>Jessica: Argh! Curse Dhoulmagus!
<se_high>Jessica: Just what is he trying to do!? Kill as many innocent people as he can!?
<se_def>*: I still can't believe Abbot Francisco's gone.
<se_def>*: I'll kill that jester! He won't ge<endash> Ahem, ahem! Urgh!
<se_def>*: Urrgh. I pray for you...Holy Father...
<se_def>*: I'm sorry that you were detained on a false charge.
<se_def>*: Their injuries are very serious, but everyone seems to be showing signs of recovery. They should all live.
<voice_0x01000C3D><se_def>*: Hm? Oh, you.
<voice_0x01000C3E><se_def>*: The Captain's been waiting for you! Hurry up!
<se_def>*: This is Captain Marcello's chamber.
<se_def>*: We have erected a temporary bridge over to the Abbot's residence.
<se_high>*: The bridge was set alight by the jester who murdered the Holy Father. May he burn in the fires of hell for his actions!
<se_high>*: Goddess on high! Send your divine retribution down upon that wicked jester!
<se_def>*: I suppose Marcello will become the next abbot. If he does, I'd say there's a good chance he'll expel Angelo from the abbey.
<se_def>*: He came here with nothing, you know. No home, no family... I'm quite worried about how he'll turn out.
<se_high>*: Marcello was handed over to the abbey's care, by his parents, when he was very young.
<se_high>*: Abbot Francisco was like his own father. Marcello must be taking it very hard indeed.
<se_def>*: We were tending to the blaze all night long. Once we'd put it out, we had to build a makeshift bridge.
<se_def>*: And now we have the sombre task of digging the Abbot's grave. I'm absolutely exhausted.
<se_def>*: Of course, Marcello's been kept in check up to now by the Abbot, to a certain degree.
<se_def>*: But now... We'll all have to be careful not to upset him.
<se_def>*: I must apologise about before. But if people act suspiciously, they must expect such treatment. I'm sure you will agree.
<se_def>*: Access to the abbey is restricted to members of the clergy at present!
<se_high>*: Angelo!
<se_def>Angelo: Oh. Aren't you<endash>?
<se_high>*: I, I never thought I'd ever be standing so close to you! Ooh, I feel all woozy...
<se_def>Angelo: Huh?
It looks like she's passed out standing up!
<se_high>*: I've been up all night waiting for Angelo. I was so worried, I couldn't sleep. (Sigh)
No answer. It looks like she's passed out standing up!
<se_high>*: Well, something must have happened. You mark my words, there's been some sort of trouble here.
<se_def>*: Have you been chucked out of the abbey too? How do they expect us to do business, eh? I don't know what I'm going to do.
<se_low>*: What's this? The Goddess is having a day off, is she!?
<se_def>*: Marcello said the death of the Abbot and the fire were both the work of that eerie jester who was here before.
<se_def>*: Why would anyone do such awful things?
<se_def>*: It's dangerous beyond this point. You must leave!
<se_def>*: I put the horse and cart in here earlier. No mistake.
<se_def>*: Maybe it got away in all the commotion when the fire broke out.
<se_def>*: It was in this very room that Abbot Francisco... No, it's too painful to talk about.
<se_def>*: The Holy Father was a pillar of strength for all of us. He was the very heart of this abbey. Curse that evil jester!
<se_def>*: We are observing a period of silence as a mark of our respect for Abbot Francisco.
<se_def>*: Abbot Francisco would often stand in that pulpit and give his wonderful sermons to us.
<se_low>*: Has something happened? Everyone seems very gloomy.
<se_def>Angelo: ............
<se_def>Angelo: Would you go and speak to the Captain, please?
<se_low>King Trode: Ah, there you are, <leader>! A little tardy, are you not!?
<se_low>King Trode: Anyway, we are no longer under suspicion!
<se_def>Marcello: Abbot Francisco's death must be avenged. In the name of the Goddess, we must bring down the iron fist of justice upon that infernal jester!
<se_def>Marcello: I hope Angelo will prove to be an asset to your party. I shall pray for your safe passage.
<se_def>*: Have you heard the news!? The Abbot's dead!
<se_def>*: And the former Templar Captain has taken his place at the head of the abbey!
<se_def>*: I'm very busy tidying the garden. I'd appreciate it if you didn't disturb me.
<se_high>*: I just can't believe Abbot Francisco's dead.
<se_high>*: I suppose his portrait will soon be on the wall here, alongside the generations of abbots who went before him.
<se_low>*: Almighty Goddess! Now may I be welcomed at the gates of heaven when I pass from this world!? I have paid 10,000 gold coins!
<se_high>*: Goddess! As a woman, surely you understand!? Please let Angelo fall in love with me!
<se_def>*: Now that we have a new abbot, special masses will obviously cost many times more than they did before.
<se_low>*: Naturally, the new Abbot is an exceptional fellow, but he's very pushy when it comes to donations.<page>*: The abbey will bankrupt me at this rate!
<se_def>*: We Templars sleep back there with the monks.
<se_def>*: Ah, Angelo! Is it really true that you were expelled? Huh huh huh!
<se_def>*: Now I can let you in on a little secret I heard. Captain Marcello and Angelo are half-brothers, apparently.
<se_def>*: They say one of them was born in wedlock, while the other is the result of a fling the father had before he was married.
<se_def>*: Captain, er...Abbot Marcello will be in charge of all abbey affairs from now on.
<se_def>*: First we must collect more donations and expand the abbey. Then we can move on to grander schemes.
<se_def>*: Why hello, Angelo. Do you REALLY think a person like YOU could avenge the Holy Father's death!?
<se_def>*: Angelo is a real trouble-maker. All the same, I'll be sad to see him leave.
<se_high>*: I wonder what I should cook for today's meal.
<se_def>*: I bet it won't stop at Angelo. If anyone else crosses Marcello, they'll be out too, you mark my words.
<se_def>*: The good times when Abbot Francisco was in charge are over now.
<se_high>*: Marcello is very able, but he's far too ambitious for a man of the cloth.
<se_high>*: Now that Abbot Francisco's gone, there's no one resolute enough to oppose Marcello.
<se_def>*: Since Marcello became Abbot, I don't know... The Templars seem to be rather over-confident. Arrogant, even.
<se_def>*: A mere monk such as I is worth nothing around here, it seems.
<se_def>*: Ouch! It still hurts! That jester was something else. We didn't stand a chance.
<se_def>*: We survive, and yet Abbot Francisco dies because of our incompetence! We do not deserve to live!
<se_def>*: The rich are unlikely to pass through the gates of heaven.
<se_def>*: Abbot Marcello is only trying to help them by demanding such generous donations.
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Abbot Marcello remains Captain of the Templars. This is his chamber. His private chamber!
<se_def>Marcello: ............
<se_def>Marcello: I have nothing to discuss with you. Leave!
<se_def>Marcello: Well, you all appear to be in good spirits.
<se_def>Marcello: No doubt drifting from place to place at your leisure is most enjoyable. But were you not supposed to be pursuing Dhoulmagus?
<se_def>*: Simply having a new abbot in charge has changed the whole atmosphere of the abbey.
<se_def>*: In a word, there's just so much more to do now. Ever since Abbot Francisco passed away, our workload has doubled!
<se_def>*: Dear Goddess, please let Abbot Marcello look upon me with favour, that I may be blessed with a position of merit and worth!
<se_def>*: Well? How about a trip to The Cock and Bull, then? There's no more Angelo to get in the way, if you know what I mean!
<se_def>*: What are you doing here, Angelo? Aren't you supposed to be going after the person who killed Abbot Francisco?<page>*: You can't laze around all your life, you know!
<se_def>*: The bunnies in the pub, the skirts in town... All back on the menu, now Angelo's out of the picture!
<se_def>*: The abbey's not for you, Angelo. You need to spread your wings. You've got potential. Don't worry about things here. Just go! Far away!
<se_def>*: Oh dear me. Maybe I should leave the abbey as well. Like Angelo.
<se_def>*: I just can't get on with Marcello.
<se_def>*: Ah-pheeeeeeweee...
<se_def>*: Huh huh huh! ...Gold! Gooold... Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Ah-ah-ah...pheeeeew...
<se_def>*: Shut up! Can't you sleep without making such a racket!?
<se_def>*: We'll all be walking on eggshells now, I suppose. Trying to judge Marcello's mood.
<se_def>*: Otherwise we'll end up like Angelo.
<se_def>*: Captain Marcello is the finest man I know! I will obey him to the end!
<se_def>Marcello: ............
<se_def>Marcello: We're too weak to avenge Abbot Francisco's death at the moment. Dhoulmagus is too formidable an opponent.

<se_def>Marcello: I'll have Angelo and those travellers ascertain his whereabouts and, if a battle ensues...<page>Marcello: Well! Perhaps I'll be lucky enough to see two ‘birds’ killed with one stone!
<se_def>Marcello: ............
<se_def>*: Wah!
<se_def>*: Oh, don't do that! You scared the living daylights out of me!
<se_def>*: I'll let you in on a little secret. I'm considering leaving the abbey.
<se_def>*: I'm just not comfortable with the way the new Abbot likes to do things. I wish Abbot Francisco was still with us.
<se_def>*: I'll let you in on a little secret. I'm considering leaving the abbey.
<se_def>*: I'm just not comfortable with the way the new Abbot likes to do things. I wish Abbot Francisco was still with us.
<se_low>*: It's all money, money, money with this new Abbot. An entrance fee here, a donation there...<page>*: The church is supposed to be the refuge of the common man!
<se_low>*: I'd always been under the impression that faith came for free!
<se_high>*: Dear Goddess, I pray to you! Make my child a bit cleverer!
<se_low>*: Almighty Goddess! Now may I be welcomed at the gates of heaven when I pass from this world!? I have paid 15,000 gold coins!
<se_def>*: Of course, front row seats in mass are only for the deeply devoted.<page>*: Naturally, they express their abundant faith by making larger donations.
<se_low>*: Humph! It's no small sum of money, but I suppose...for appearance's sake...
<se_def>*: What are you doing, loitering around here?
<se_def>*: Common worshippers are permitted into the chapel and no further! Get out of here!
<se_def>*: What are you doing here, Angelo? Still hanging around, are you? We've no use for the likes of you!
<se_high>*: Abbot Marcello is a very strict man. He has ordered us to refrain from private talk.
<se_def>*: Hm? You...? Yes, you're Angelo's <IF_SOLO>friend<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>friends<ENDIF_SOLO>, aren't you? So, how is Angelo, then?
<se_def>*: Ah! Angelo! Don't expect there to be a bed here for you now!
<se_def>*: We have to watch Marcello's mood very carefully.
<se_def>*: That's more important than praying now. How things have changed here in the abbey!
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah! Ah-phew...
<se_def>Marcello: Well, well! Can I help you with something?
<se_def>Marcello: Hm... The Moonshadow harp? The name is certainly familiar.
<se_def>Marcello: Ah, yes. I read it in a book that was donated to the abbey from Ascantha.
<se_def>Marcello: But why on earth are you looking for it? You do get some strange ideas into your heads, don't you?
<se_def>Marcello: Yes, I'm sure I've seen mention of a Moonshadow harp in a book that was donated to the abbey from Ascantha.
<se_def>Marcello: But why on earth are you looking for it? You do get some strange ideas into your heads, don't you?
<se_def>Marcello: ............
<se_def>Marcello: I've no further business with you. Have you tracked down Dhoulmagus yet, hm!? Then leave!
<se_def>*: Ever since Captain Marcello became Abbot, everything in the abbey just seems to have fallen into place.
<se_high>*: Several monks died trying to protect Abbot Francisco.
<se_high>*: So I implore you to bring the culprit to justice. Avenge the Abbot's death. And the loss of my friends.
<se_high>*: I don't like the basement guards. They make me feel uneasy.
<se_def>*: Our orders are to keep this place as clean and tidy as it was when Abbot Francisco was alive.
<se_def>*: It's a full-time job.
<se_def>*: Oh Goddess! Let me enjoy success like Abbot Marcello has!
<se_def>*: The donations from the rich have increased five-fold since Marcello has been at the head of the abbey's affairs.
<se_def>*: He's quite a business man!
<se_def>*: I can't imagine the likes of Marcello being satisfied with an abbacy in an out of the way place like this.
<se_def>*: If you ask me, he's collecting money so he can... No, perhaps I shouldn't say.
<se_high>*: With the huge increases in church-goers' financial contributions, you would have expected some sort of improvement in our diet, really.
<se_high>*: But it's still the same old food. Where on earth is all the money going?
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Abbot-phew...Marcello... Three-phew...cheers-phew...
<se_def>*: AH-PHEW... AH-PHEW...
<se_def>*: Ah-ah-ah-pheeeew... Ah-ah-ah-.........-pheeeew...

<se_high>*: What's a guy got to do to get some sleep around here!?
The Templar next door's snoring is driving me MAD!
<se_high>*: Dear Goddess, please let me grow a little taller.<page>*: Everyone says intelligence is related to height, you see, and I don't want people thinking I'm from Simpleton!
<se_low>*: Dear, beloved Goddess! Surely now I'll be welcomed with open arms at the gates of heaven when my time comes!?<page>*: I have paid 30,000 gold coins!
<se_def>*: Marcello wants to turn this abbey into a training ground for the Templars.
<se_def>*: No doubt we mere monks will all be turned out onto the street before long. Oh, dear Goddess! Help us!
<se_def>Marcello: Welcome back. It seems you have more free time than you know what to do with.
<se_def>Marcello: And let's say, by some remote chance, that is a genuine Moonshadow harp. What good do you think will come of showing it to me?
<se_def>Marcello: You really are a strange <IF_SOLO>one<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>little band<ENDIF_SOLO>, even for <IF_SOLO>a traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>. Your methods are utterly ridiculous!
<se_def>Marcello: ............
<se_def>Marcello: Well, what is it!? What do you want!?
<se_def>Marcello: So, you've come to report that you've successfully located the Moonshadow harp? Congratulations.
<se_def>Marcello: But your mission is to locate Dhoulmagus, not some harp! Don't let yourself be distracted!
<se_high>*: Abbot Marcello makes frequent trips to visit the highest authorities within the church. He seems very busy.
<se_high>*: Sometimes I hear a voice coming from the back room when there shouldn't be anyone about. A moaning voice.
<se_high>*: But whenever I go to see who it is, the room's empty.
<se_high>*: It sends a shiver down my spine!
<se_def>*: I'm leaving this abbey today. You can't stop me!
<se_def>*: I'm just not comfortable with the way the new Abbot likes to do things. I wish Abbot Francisco was still with us.
<se_def>*: ...Although I've been saying that for over a month now. I just can't bring myself to leave.
<se_high>*: The whole atmosphere here in the abbey is different these days. All the monks look rather depressed.
<se_low>*: Dear, beloved Goddess! Surely now I'll be welcomed with open arms at the gates of heaven when my time comes!?<page>*: I have paid 20,000 gold coins!
<se_def>*: Abbot Marcello? No, I'm sorry. He's away at the moment. I don't think he'll be returning for some time yet.
<se_def>*: He only set off the other day, you see.<page>*: He said he needed to report to the Holy Isle of Neos and His Holiness, the Lord High Priest, that he had been inaugurated as the new Abbot.
<se_def>*: It's such a waste not putting this huge garden to use. It would be perfect as a training area, don't you think?
<se_def>*: There's plenty of space here to wield a sword. Hmmm... Yes... This would be ideal.
<se_def>*: Captain Marcello's orders were to train everyday. We must brush up our sword skills.
<se_high>*: We are mere monks. All we can do is watch as events take place around us.
<se_high>*: But everything that happens is the Goddess's will...
<se_def>*: Abbot Marcello is going to rise even further through the ranks. He'll go a long way, you mark my words.
<se_def>*: I'm behind him all the way. Whatever happens.
<se_def>*: I am nobility! We're a different breed from these commoners who've been permitted to join the ranks recently. Completely different.
<se_def>*: Observe! See the dignity with which I hold myself! My majesty! The natural authority I exude! My dashing appearance!? Look! Look at me!
<se_high>*: Nowadays, we monks get different food to the Templars.
<se_high>*: We're on vegetable soup so thin you have to look twice to make sure your bowl's not empty!<page>*: Meanwhile their plates are piled high with succulent steaks! It's just not right, is it?
<se_def>*: With Marcello away, the atmosphere's a little better around here. At least we can all relax a bit.
<se_def>*: Apparently, Captain Marcello wants to expand the Templars.
<se_def>*: That's why he's relaxing the old rules, and allowing commoners to join. We're not all nobility now.<page>*: Skill alone determines who is accepted and who is turned away.
<se_def>*: Cor! So this is where we all kip, eh!? It ain't like the back o' the alley in Pickham where I used to get me 'ead down! Huh huh huh! Sweet!
<se_high>*: However much it's changed, I could never bring myself to leave this abbey. The memories of Abbot Francisco are too strong.
<se_high>*: We must endure these hard times. It is a test. The Goddess is confirming our devotion.
<se_high>*: We can't stay here in the abbey now! Let's run away! Come on! Let's go to some other church.
<se_def>*: Abbot Francisco was born to a poor miller. When he grew up, he chose to follow the path of faith.
<se_def>*: He was the model of devotion to the Goddess. An example to us all. He still is now, even in death.

<se_def>*: I warn you, <IF_SOLO>traveller<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>travellers<ENDIF_SOLO>. This abbey is no longer a place of worship. For your own <IF_SOLO>sake<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>sakes<ENDIF_SOLO>, you should leave.
<se_def>*: I can't take any more of this! Who do the Templars think they are, wandering around the abbey as if they owned the place!?
<se_def>*: What on earth is Abbot Marcello trying to do!?
<se_def>*: Almighty Goddess, let me be noticed by Abbot Marcello! Let him show favour towards me and give me a promotion!
<se_def>*: We monks have no money. We are simple folk who choose to live a life of prayer and worship. We don't have anywhere else to go.
<se_def>*: Whatever happens, we have no choice but to continue living here in the abbey.
<se_high>*: Stop and think about what you're saying! Just where do you expect to go after you leave the abbey, hm!?
<se_def>*: I'll go to a church somewhere else and do chores or something. Anything is better than staying here. ...Surely?
<se_high>*: Oh, I'm so hungry. I'm starting to feel dizzy.
<se_def>*: Nearly all of the donations to the abbey end up as gourmet dinners on the Templars' plates.
<se_def>*: And the remainder is spent on weapons and armour and fast horses, apparently.
<se_def>*: Well none of that fills the stomachs of the hungry, does it!? What does the Abbot think he's doing!?
<se_def>*: In the good old days, we used to be able to go and have some fun at The Cock and Bull every now and then.<page>*: But there's no money for that kind of thing any more.
<se_def>*: The Abbot's found everyone's secret savings and confiscated them.
<se_def>*: Urgh-phew... Urgh-phew...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: Zzzzz... (Gurgle, gurgle.) ...zzzzz...
<se_def>*: (BURP!)
<se_def>*: Urgh! I've eaten too much! My belly's so full, I can't get to sleep.
<se_def>*: Ah...pheeeeew...
<se_def>*: Ah-phew... Ah-phew...
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: From what I hear, Abbot Francisco enjoys a good laugh.
<se_def>*: Apparently he sometimes invites travelling performers to his residence on the quiet to entertain him.
<se_low>*: I've travelled for days to ask of the wisdom of the famous Abbot Francisco, but the Templars refuse to let me see him.
<se_low>*: I did hear there was a secret passage leading to the island from some dilapidated building nearby.<page>*: But I just can't find the entrance to it.
<se_def>*: Please, dear Goddess! Please bring me success!
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_high>*: The Templars have always used their rings as tools. Since long before the abbey moved to its current home in the middle of the river.
<se_high>*: Apparently, they used to use them as keys of some sort back in the old days.
<se_def>*: Our sleeping quarters are upstairs.
<se_def>*: And the dungeon is at the bottom of those steps.
<se_def>*: That's where we lock up sinners.
<se_def>*: Although...there has been the odd occasion when innocent people have been imprisoned by mistake!
<se_low>*: The abbey is demanding some rather large donations for Abbot Francisco's wonderful sermons.
<se_low>*: And I mean REALLY large donations. What on earth does the abbey intend to do with all the gold it must be amassing?
<se_def>*: We've an unusually large number of visitors today. <IF_SOLO>You<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>You people<ENDIF_SOLO> are with that jester, are you?
<se_def>*: If you're looking for him, he disappeared off down the corridor. You'd better hurry if you want to catch up with him.
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: There's a rumour going around at the moment about a strange jester in the abbey who can walk on water!
<se_def>*: It's true, you know. I've seen him myself. No mistake. I know what I saw.
<se_def>*: It's not my shift! Can't you see I'm trying to get some shut-eye!?
<se_def>*: ...Angelo? He's not up here, as far as I know.
<se_def>No answer. It looks like he's passed out.
<se_high>*: Somebody! Save the Abbot!
<se_def>*: Urgh! I'm not...going to make it... That jester...
<se_def>*: I...couldn't stop him! He's...after Abbot...Francisco...!
<se_def>*: Uuuurgh...
<se_def>*: The Holy Father...is in danger...
<se_def>*: He...that jester...seemed to be acting normally when he first arrived.
<se_def>*: But then...he suddenly went mad. He started laughing...hysterically and ran off up...to the Holy Father's chamber.
<se_def>*: W-We tried to stop him. But...even with three of us...
<se_def>*: Urgh... Who is he...? That...jester...
<se_def>*: The...Abbot... Some...one, please...save...
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_low>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: Our sleeping quarters are upstairs.
<se_def>*: And the dungeon is at the bottom of those steps.
<se_def>*: That's where we lock up sinners.
<se_def>*: Unclean vagrants are not permitted to approach the Holy Altar!
<se_def>*: May the Goddess strike you down! This is exactly why the Templars need to guard it!
<se_def>*: You're still hanging around here, are you? Hmph.
<se_low>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_low>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_low>*: DUMMY LINE
<se_def>*: Our Templar's rings are engraved with the emblem of the abbey.
<se_def>*: Only Abbot Francisco and we Templars are permitted to wear these rings. They're engraved with the emblem of the abbey.<page>*: Normal monks are not worthy of such a privilege.
<se_def>*: Next to his faith and his life, the ring is a Templar's most treasured possession. But Angelo...! Hmph!
<se_def>*: The wrath of the Goddess is upon us! The red glow in the sky is the heavens opening! The time of judgement is nigh!<page>*: And those fools still insist on their horseplay!
<se_def>*: This is no abbey now. No place of worship. You should leave, <IF_SOLO>pilgrim<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>pilgrims<ENDIF_SOLO>!
<se_low>*: What's going on? There seems to be quite a commotion back there.
<se_def>*: Pray! If you wish to be spared, pray for the mercy of the Goddess!
<se_def>*: I tried to leave the abbey once, but I had nowhere else to go.

<se_def>*: After all, now that Abbot Francisco has taken his place at the Goddess's side, the responsibility has fallen to us monks.<page>*: We have to watch over the abbey and its future. So here I am.
<se_def>*: No doubt the nearby villagers will be coming soon. Looking for shelter from this ominous red sky.
<se_def>*: As a humble servant of the Goddess, I have a duty to help the lost and the bewildered. I cannot leave the abbey.
<se_high>*: Great Abbots of the past! Plead with the Goddess!
<se_high>*: Save the sinful Templars and save this wretched world!
<se_def>*: If you want to avoid getting embroiled with a drunken rabble, I suggest you steer clear of the building behind here.
<se_def>*: Those misguided Templars are celebrating Marcello's accession. They're getting very boisterous.
<se_def>*: That's the way to our chambers. Where we Templars sleep.
<se_def>*: Damn it! Why does it have to be my shift now!? Why can't I join in the party!?
<se_def>*: Huh huh hic!
<se_def>*: Look at those <endash> Hic! <endash> huge, red fireworks! Everyone in the world is <endash> Hic! <endash> celebrating Marcello becoming Lord High Priest. Hic!
<se_high>*: That's it! Come on! Gimme your money! ♪
<se_def>*: It won't be long before Captain Marcello is officially named Lord High Priest on the Holy Isle of Neos! Hurrah!
<se_def>*: What are you doing here!? Get your miserable <IF_SOLO>face<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>faces<ENDIF_SOLO> out of my sight! You're putting me off my drink! Hic!
<se_def>*: I knew it! I always believed Marcello would go a long way.
<se_def>*: He and I were born under the same star! So here's to his success. I'll drink to it all night long!
<se_def>*: Ooooh... Maybe I've had a bit too much. The sky's flickering blue and red.
<se_high>*: Erm... Are all you knights okay?
<se_def>*: Uuuurgh!
<se_def>*: D-Don't talk to <endash> Hic! <endash> me! Uuuurgh!
<se_def>*: ThiS is the Bbest driink I'VE had in aaages.
<se_high>*: What are this lot like!? It's back-breaking, carrying all these bottles backwards and forwards!
<se_def>*: Urgh...urgh...
<se_high>*: I keep cooking more and more food, but I just can't keep up with their orders.
<se_high>*: I need help!
<se_def>*: Hey! Where's the rest of the food!? I'm ravenous!
<se_def>*: Huh huh! The Captain's chair's a lot more comfortable than any of ours! Hic!
<se_def>*: Now we have to sleep in either the dungeon or the stables. We're having to live like dogs! It's too much!
<se_high>*: Let me sleep! Sleeping's about the only pleasure we have nowadays.
<se_def>*: Keep the noise down! Urgh, the whole place reeks of alcohol.
<se_def>*: The Templars' quarters are...behind here...are...the Templars' quarters...
<se_def>*: Hic!
<se_high>*: When I worked in the Baccarat casino, I was the best bunny girl they had.
<se_high>*: I'm not going to be outdone by some brazen hussy! So come on! Let's dance! ♪
<se_high>*: Hey! Come on! Let's dance together!
<se_def>*: Whoa! Look at her move! Nice!
<se_def>*: If I had to choose one of those three to go out with...
<se_def>*: Wow! That'd be a tough choice!
<se_def>*: A good knight needs a thorough education in how to handle his sword.<page>*: A good night, on the other hand, requires him to know how to handle his drink and his women! Ha ha!
<se_def>*: So let's drink! And drink and drink until we can handle no more!
<se_def>*: Ah, drinking in the middle of the day makes it go down even better! Who wants to only drink in the evening!?
<se_high>*: This non-stop cooking and washing up is making my skin crack.
<se_def>*: Three cheers for Captain Marcello! Hurrah! Hurrah! Hurrah!
<se_high>*: Maybe I slept too much in the afternoon. I just can't nod off now. Help me rest, dear Goddess!
<se_def>*: How can I sleep with this stench of horse dung!?<page>*: This must be the Goddess's way of punishing me for doing nothing to stop Marcello's unruliness.
<se_def>*: Urgh...urgh...
<se_high>*: Abbot Francisco on high! How your exalted and noble soul led us on the path of righteousness!
<se_high>*: Please, save our troubled world. And save the sinful Templars. Dear Abbot Francisco...
<se_high>*: The wounded seem to be delirious. They keep talking about some jester or other.
<se_def>*: There was a jester here just a moment ago. He'd come to visit the Holy Father. There was something rather eerie about him actually.
<se_def>*: Hm? You're looking for him? Who, that jester?
<se_def>*: Oh, no, no! Only those with the express permission of Captain Marcello can come through here!
<se_def>*: Then leave at once! I wouldn't let you through here in any case!
<se_def>*: Abbot Francisco is a very kind and gentle soul. He would agree to see anyone who requested an audience with him.
<se_def>*: That's why we're here. To protect him from the riff-raff he's too polite to turn away! Now clear off!
<se_low>*: Ever since I made eye contact with that jester, I just haven't been feeling right.
<se_low>*: Still, that's by the by. Now then, what was it I was here for again? Hm... Pity, I can't seem to remember.
<se_def>*: There was a jester who came through here before. He was incredibly talented. But all the while he was muttering something to himself.
<se_def>*: I strained my ears to hear what he was saying, but all I could catch was him repeating the words, ‘Pity... Such a pity...’
<se_def>*: Jesters always look so carefree on the surface, but I suppose they have their share of problems to deal with, just like the rest of us.
<se_def>*: Wow! I've never seen anything like it! The jester that the Holy Father has summoned is an unbelievably talented performer!
<se_def>*: I tell you, he's here one minute, and over there the next! In the blink of an eye! He just vanishes and pops up somewhere else!
<se_def>*: Yes, there was a jester here just a moment ago. He was on his way to the Abbot's chamber.
<se_def>*: He had a rather odd-looking cane with him. No doubt he uses it in his performances. He probably balances on it or something.
<se_high>*: I haven't seen a jester since I was a boy. They're actually rather scary-looking people nowadays, aren't they?
<se_high>*: I don't know how they make people laugh. It's a bit strange if you ask me.
<se_def>*: This is the interrogation room. Beyond it is the torture chamber, used in days of old to convert heretics to the faith.
<se_def>Angelo: I can't divulge too much information, but let's just say I'm onto something big here at the abbey, and I can't leave.
<se_def>Angelo: I can only reiterate what I told you before. There's just one way to get to the island where Abbot Francisco lives.
<se_def>Angelo: You have to leave the abbey as if you were going to Simpleton, but turn immediately left along the river.<page>Angelo: Just follow the river along, keeping the abbey in view.
<se_def>Angelo: If you keep going along the river, you'll come to the entrance of the old abbey ruin.
<se_def>Angelo: They say there's an underground passageway leading from there to the small island where the Abbot's residence is.
<se_def>Angelo: I've been told you can open the entrance to the ruin with the Templar's ring I gave you. So go now! Hurry!
<se_def>*: I'm off duty now. Let me sleep!
<se_def>*: This is Captain Marcello's chamber!
<se_def>*: The Captain is engaged in business at the moment! No one is permitted to enter this room. No one!
